stories.title: Replicating Milgram – Would People Still Obey Today? [pdf]

stories.text:
I’m in the market for a new TV. I’d like it to be as dumb as possible. I don’t subscribe to any streaming services and download everything through torrents. I don’t want a TV that requires an internet connection and I really don’t want it to do anything other than display what I send to it. What’s the best TV for someone like me?

It doesn’t have to be totally dumb; I know these are expensive and I’m ok with a few features. But I need to be able to ignore them and I don’t want it to stop working when the manufacturer rolls out an “update”.
stories.title: Ask HN: What’s the Best TV to Buy?

stories.text:
Now that the original ELIZA code is available (elizagen.org), we should figure out how to make it run. It's in MAD-SLIP. There's an Open Source MAD interpreter (due to ESR: http://www.catb.org/~esr/mad/) and JW published most of SLIP (with the notable exception of YMATCH and ASSMBL -- but these are well documented).

Oh...right, a question: Is there an open source challenges page where where folks could publish problems like this one?
stories.title: Make Mad Eliza Work

stories.text: Do you or your company use blockchain for anything which is not crypto trading or NFT? Have you run a trial? Have you ever contemplated using it for any use case?
stories.title: Ask HN: Does your company use blockchain?
